intro: Descurainia canescens var. appendiculata, commonly known as the sandstem flax, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its structure includes a branching stem with opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The species is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its resilience and distinctive appearance.
